Title: Data Scientist
Description:
CT19 are working with one of our key MedTech clients in the South of France who are actively hiring for a Data Scientist to join their expanding R&D and Product Development team. This company are at the forefront of technology, combining AI, Robotics and image processing to revolutionise the surgery for cardiovascular related disease.




In just 4 years since being founded, they have grown to a company of circa 30 employee's, all primarily in engineering /R&D disciplines. They have also developed their technology to the point where surgery has been performed successfully on an animal model, considering medical devices can take time to get to market, this is very impressive!




We are looking for someone who has proven experience working in the Medical device industry, ideally within medical image processing and has taken a product through to FDA clearance.




Please see below for more information about what you can expect from the day to day:

Be a key contributor to new technology development in the area of computer vision and machine learning
Develop learning based solutions for a variety of tasks in medical data/imaging analysis
Further enhance medical software applications and patents
Write and maintain accurate documentation of concepts, algorithms and regulations




Skillset/experience we are looking for:

Strong academic background in computer science/software engineering
experience with FDA documentation (worked to IEC 62304)
Strong proficiency in Python, C and C++
Proven background in mathematics, statistics, data structure and algorithms
Proficiency in one of the mainstream deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow/PyTorch
Hands on experience with medical image processing and 3D data visualization




Please reach out to mason@ct-19.co.uk for more information.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us:

HCKD.AI is a cutting-edge tech house designed to tackle unusual problems where normal solutions won't work. We specialize in developing innovative solutions that leverage the latest in cloud technologies to solve complex challenges across various industries.




Job Description:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist with a strong focus on ETL processes to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a background in Python and SQL (Postgres) and some experience with AWS. As a Data Scientist at HCKD.AI, you will be responsible for developing and managing ETL processes, analyzing complex data sets, and creating data-driven solutions to support our business objectives.




Six month initial contract.




Key Responsibilities:

ETL Development: Design, develop, and manage ETL processes to ensure data integrity and availability.
Data Management: Design, implement, and optimize SQL databases (Postgres, using Supabase) to manage and store data efficiently.
Data Analysis: Analyze large and complex data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that drive business decisions.
AWS Integration: Utilize AWS services such as S3 and Lambda to support data processing and storage needs.
Collaboration: Work closely with other data scientists, engineers, and stakeholders to integrate data solutions into various projects and workflows.
Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of data processes, models, and analysis.




Required Skills and Qualifications:

Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python and SQL (Postgres). Experience with AWS services, including Lambda and S3.
ETL Processes: Strong experience in developing and managing ETL processes.
Database Management: Experience in designing and optimizing SQL databases (Postgres, using Supabase).
Data Analysis: Strong analytical skills with experience in statistical analysis and machine learning.
Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle complex issues where normal solutions won't work.
Collaboration: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a remote team environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

AWS Experience: Experience with other AWS services such as DynamoDB, API Gateway, and CloudWatch.
Machine Learning: Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Data Visualization: Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible working hours and remote work opportunities.
A dynamic and innovative work environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
The chance to work on cutting-edge projects that make a real impact.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Please choose from the Role Library, plus any other HM-determined qualifications (please ensure they are quantifiable)
Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En Capitole estamos buscando un/a Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro equipo.

Si eres apasionado/a por los datos y tienes habilidades para convertir grandes volúmenes de datos en ideas procesables, ¡queremos conocerte!




¿Por qué Capitole?

🤝 Nuestros empleados lo primero. Creemos en un modelo diferente, más humano, colocamos a las personas en el centro de nuestra empresa.

👨‍💻 Proyectos interesantes. Tecnologías de vanguardia. Metodologías ágiles.

🚀 Felicidad y baja tasa de rotación

🎓1200€ anuales de formación a la carta

🕓 Horario flexible

🎯 Trayectoria profesional a medida

🩺 Seguro médico privado

💰 Retribución flexible

🦾 Plan Andjoy

🥳 Un montón de eventos increíbles

💻Comunidades tecnológicas para que compartas tus conocimientos e ideas con los demás equipos. ¡¡¡Compartir el conocimiento interno es fundamental!!!

¡Por último y no menos importante, un EQUIPAZO!




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Formarás parte de un proyecto internacional para uno de nuestros clientes TOP del sector Seguridad.

Podrás hacerlo 3 días a la semana desde casa con un horario flexible para equilibrar tu vida profesional y personal!




¿Qué buscamos?

Eres la persona ideal para el puesto si:

Te apasionan los datos y has participado anteriormente en proyectos de datos, puntualmente en la creación de modelos estadísticos o de aprendizaje automático
Has trabajado previamente con Python
Te gustan los entornos internacionales y estás habituado a trabajar en inglés diariamente.




¿Aún no nos conoces? ¡¡Descúbrenos!! https://capitole-consulting.com/

Mira lo que opinan de nosotros 👀 https://www.glassdoor.es/Opiniones/Capitole-Consulting-Opiniones-E2060890.htm




No dudes en enviarnos tu perfil, ¡estamos deseando conocerte!

Title: Data Scientist | Milano - Roma
Description:
SINTESI




Il/la Data Scientist in Be acquisisce competenze distintive in ambito AI e Machine Learning, comprende le esigenze di business dei clienti ed è capace di tradurle in algoritmi, sa rappresentare i dati in apposite dashboard, utilizza la propria esperienza e le proprie conoscenze per migliorare ed efficientare i processi dei clienti.

Big Data & Advanced Analytics | Milano




PERCHÉ SCEGLIEREMO TE?

Hai una formazione in discipline scientifiche (Laurea Magistrale in Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria, PhD)
Ti appassiona la rivoluzione in atto su tematiche AI, Machine Learning, NLP
Hai una buona conoscenza di Python (oppure di: R, Matlab, Octave, SPSS, SAS)
Hai una conoscenza base di SQL
Hai una conoscenza della statistica descrittiva di base (media, mediana, moda, percentili, rappresentazione tramite istogrammi)
Hai familiarità con analisi dei dati, verifica del test d’ipotesi, calcolo combinatorio, distribuzioni di probabilità e processi stocastica
Parli un ottimo inglese




Se ritieni sia giunto il momento per affrontare nuove sfide e vuoi entrare in un’azienda dinamica, orientata all’innovazione e all’evoluzione tecnologica




Be è la società che fa per te! Aspettiamo la tua candidatura!




COSA TI OFFRIAMO




In Be Management Consulting ti offriamo la possibilità acquisire competenze verticali e distintive partecipando a progettualità complesse a stretto contatto con i principali player del settore Banking.




Entrerai a far parte di un ambiente di lavoro collaborativo, dove le idee innovative sono incoraggiate e la diversità è valorizzata.




Investiamo nel tuo sviluppo professionale offrendoti programmi di formazione personalizzati e opportunità di crescita all’interno di un gruppo in grande espansione a livello nazionale e internazionale




CHI SIAMO




Be Shaping the Future, parte del gruppo Engineering, è tra i principali player in ambito Management Consulting e ICT Solutions. La Società fornisce servizi di Business Advisory, Information Technology e Digital Engagement. Grazie alla combinazione di competenze specialistiche, tecnologie proprietarie avanzate e un patrimonio di esperienza consolidata, il Gruppo supporta primarie istituzioni finanziarie, assicurative e industriali nelle più importanti sfide della trasformazione digitale. Con circa 2.000 dipendenti e sedi in Italia, Regno Unito, Germania, Austria, Svizzera, Lussemburgo, Spagna, Romania, Repubblica Ceca, Polonia, Albania e Ucraina, nel 2021 il Gruppo ha registrato ricavi per 235,3 milioni di euro.




Be Management Consulting è la società del Gruppo Be | Shaping the Future che si occupa di Business Advisory. Tra le più riconosciute del settore per la capacità di gestire e supportare le trasformazioni complesse dell’ecosistema dei Financial Services, Be MC si distingue per la sua capacità di calarsi nella realtà dei suoi Clienti mettendo a disposizione competenze specialistiche e capacità nell’orchestrare soluzioni end to end sartoriali. Le nostre persone lavorano in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante, che tiene in grande considerazione la formazione dei singoli e promuove la dedizione, l’accuratezza e la flessibilità nello stare al passo con i continui mutamenti che il contesto lavorativo impone ogni giorno.




Durante il colloquio risponderemo a tutte le tue curiosità su Be e ci dirai come puoi fare la differenza. Let's shape our future together!




Per maggiori informazioni sul Gruppo Be visitate il nostro sito: www.be-tse.it

A., Be Shaping the Future Corporate Services S.p.A., Be Shaping the Future DigiTech Solutions S.p.A., IQUII Srl, Tesla Consulting Srl, Dream Of Ordinary Madness Entertainment S.r.l, Be Your Essence S.r.L , Be Poland Think, Solve & Execute Sp. z o. o., iBe Think Solve, Execute Ltd., targit GmbH, Be Think, Solve, Execute RO s.r.l., Be Ukraine Think, Solve, Execute LLC., nonché di ogni altra società appartenente al Gruppo Be. HTML:
SINTESI


Il/la Data Scientist in Be acquisisce competenze distintive in ambito AI e Machine Learning, comprende le esigenze di business dei clienti ed è capace di tradurle in algoritmi, sa rappresentare i dati in apposite dashboard, utilizza la propria esperienza e le proprie conoscenze per migliorare ed efficientare i processi dei clienti.

Big Data & Advanced Analytics | Milano


PERCHÉ SCEGLIEREMO TE?

  • Hai una formazione in discipline scientifiche (Laurea Magistrale in Statistica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria, PhD)
  • Ti appassiona la rivoluzione in atto su tematiche AI, Machine Learning, NLP
  • Hai una buona conoscenza di Python (oppure di: R, Matlab, Octave, SPSS, SAS)
  • Hai una conoscenza base di SQL
  • Hai una conoscenza della statistica descrittiva di base (media, mediana, moda, percentili, rappresentazione tramite istogrammi)
  • Hai familiarità con analisi dei dati, verifica del test d’ipotesi, calcolo combinatorio, distribuzioni di probabilità e processi stocastica
  • Parli un ottimo inglese


Se ritieni sia giunto il momento per affrontare nuove sfide e vuoi entrare in un’azienda dinamica, orientata all’innovazione e all’evoluzione tecnologica


Be è la società che fa per te! Aspettiamo la tua candidatura!
